wikipedia_page.main: Des Harlock (20 December 1922 – 6 April 1981) was a Welsh footballer who played as an outside right for Liverpool, Tranmere Rovers, Stafford Rangers and Macclesfield Town. He made 158 appearances for Tranmere, scoring 18 goals.

response: 6 April 1981: Des Harlock, 58, played 150 league games for Tranmere Rovers as a right-winger between 1946 and 1954 after signing from Liverpool in 1945, his league debut delayed until his 24th year due to the war.
